metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0816 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 37.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.6, and Thunderbirdbefore 31.6 do not properly restrict resource: URLs, which makes it easierfor remote attackers to execute arbitrary JavaScript code with chromeprivileges by leveraging the ability to bypass the Same Origin Policy, asdemonstrated by the resource: URL associated with PDF.js.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
